title: Flatten Nested Array
description: Convert a nested array into a single-level array
instructions:
Write a function `flattenArray(arr)` that takes a nested array (one level deep) and returns a flattened array.

Example: flattenArray([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5]]) should return [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

Note: Only handle arrays nested one level deep

hints.content: You'll need nested loops: one to go through each sub-array, and another to go through elements within each sub-array.
Use an outer loop to iterate through arr, and an inner loop to iterate through arr[i]. Push each element from the inner array to your result array.
Create `const flattened = [];`. Outer loop: `for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++)`. Inner loop: `for (let j = 0; j < arr[i].length; j++)`. Then `flattened.push(arr[i][j])`.

learningObjectives: Building single arrays from nested structures
